definition: to sing opera music (without staging or make up)
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: The Glee Club decided to present an oratorio during their recital.
sentences.chinese: 高兴俱乐部的决定提出的清唱剧在其演奏。

sentences.english: "Die Katze last das Mausen nicht", from the "Coffee Cantata", BWV 211
Cappella clouds go, playing the string to wind Sa.
sentences.chinese: 清唱云不去，弹弦风飒来。

sentences.english: In the wind, singing boatmen, the boat slowly forward.
sentences.chinese: 在微凉的轻风里，船夫清唱，小船缓缓前行。

sentences.english: Aria, a song that is sung by one person in an oratorio.
sentences.chinese: 清唱剧中的一曲独唱，仿佛清澈江洋中那一波激流。

sentences.english: Barrymore says Grant sang acappella and it sounded really good.
sentences.chinese: 巴里摩尔说格兰特的一段清唱非常好听。

sentences.english: Its peaks are the symphony and the oratorio.
sentences.chinese: 其顶峰为交响乐和清唱剧。

sentences.english: Most of his oratorios are in the Bibliothèque Nationale at Paris .
sentences.chinese: 他的清唱剧大部分是在国家图书馆在巴黎。

sentences.english: The oratorio is being prepared. At this juncture Bach appears, and creates cantatas that endure.
sentences.chinese: 清唱剧产生在即的当口，巴赫带着他的康塔塔出现了。

definition: vocal accompaniment/to accompany a singer/to support of sb/to echo sb/to chime in with sb
to sing and play (plucked string instrument)
sung performance/to sing for an audience
singing voice/fig. original voice of a poet
